channel.title: Tum on The Neurogineering Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tum on The Neurogineering Blog

item.title: Conference on Clinical Neurotechnologies and Healthy Aging
item.description: In June, Nicolas and I made our way to TÃ¼bingen to attend the German-Israeli Conference on Clinical Neurotechnologies and Healthy Aging. The focus lay on brain stimulation which could even be tested during the coffee breaks (I prefer not to show the video of my involuntarily kicking legs here). When speaking of the ‘brain’ the retina is also meant (of course). On the last day the MedTech Startup School offered an Open Innovation Day where we discussed several aspects of founding a Neuro-Tech start-up.

item.title: CoC Neuro-Engineering Networking Workshop
Links
item.description: Official program page with information about application, faculty members and the program itself: msne.ei.tum.de Our Github repository with this page and other projects: github.com/neuroengineering The homepage of the Neuroengineering Journal Club: neuroengineering.blog/njc/

item.title: Students
item.description: .card { box-shadow: 0 4px 8px 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4); width:50%; height: 350px; max-width:200px; margin: 10px 5px; text-align: center; background-color: #f5f5f5; padding: 5px 5px 5px 5px; float: left; } card.col1 { float: left; width: 20%; } card.col2 { float: left; width: 70%; } card.title { font-size: 100pt; } a.link { text-decoration: none; font-size: 18px; } .image-cropper { width: 100px; height: 100px; margin: 10px auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; border-radius: 50%; } img { display: inline; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; height: 100%; width: 100%; margin: 0 auto;.
